Package scrabble.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
scrabble.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
This class represents the Scrabble game. It is responsible for modeling the game and all the components.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Player[] players, Board board, Ruleset ruleset, Player me)
      Constructor for the Game class. Initializes players, board, ruleset, and the local player.
      Parameters:
      players - Array of players participating in the game
      board - The game board
      ruleset - The ruleset for the game
      me - The local player

  • Method Details

    • playTiles

      public boolean playTiles​(int playerID, Tile[] tiles)
      Plays tiles on the board for a player
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player for whom to make a play
      tiles - the tiles to be placed. must have at least on tile
      Returns:
      true if the play is successful, false otherwise See Board.playTiles()

    • challenge

      public boolean challenge()
      This method will initiate a challenge on the most recent turn from the local player. The challenge will fail if any word from the turn is not in the game dictionary. The game object updates the Player and Board objects according to the result of the challenge
      Returns:
      true if the challenge passes. False if it fails

    • getCurrentPlayerTime

      public int getCurrentPlayerTime()

    • setCurrentPlayerTime

      public void setCurrentPlayerTime​(int currentPlayerTime)

    • getGameTime

      public int getGameTime()

    • setGameTime

      public void setGameTime​(int gameTime)

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public int getCurrentPlayer()

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer​(int currentPlayer)

    • increaseScore

      public void increaseScore​(int playerID, int amount)
      Increases the score of the specified player by the specified amount. Note that the score can be decreased by passing a negative number
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player for whom to increase the score
      amount - by which to increase player score

    • passTurn

      public void passTurn​(int ID)
      Passes the turn from this player to the next player This method updates the player's status to inactive if they have passed their previous turn, otherwise only their passedLastTurn field is updated. The current player changes to the next player in the order.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the player for whom to pass a turn This ID must correspond to the ID of the current player

    • setConnected

      public void setConnected​(int playerID, boolean isConnected)
      Changes the status of the player's connection Note this change should only be made for NetworkPlayers, and not for the local player. The latter will cause errors.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the player to change the status of
      isConnected - The new status of the player

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected​(int playerID)
      Checks if a player is connected.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The ID of the player to check
      Returns:
      true if the player is connected, false otherwise

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive​(int playerID)
      Checks if a player is active.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The ID of the player to check
      Returns:
      true if the player is active, false otherwise

    • setActive

      public void setActive​(int playerID, boolean isActive)
      Changes the ability of the specified player to make plays
      Parameters:
      playerID - the player for whom to change activity status
      isActive - the status of the player

    • decreaseRack

      public void decreaseRack​(int playerID, int amount)
      changes the rack size of specified player. This method should only be called on NetworkPlayers.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the player for whom to change the rack size.
      amount - the amount to change the rack size by. Note that the total size of a player's rack should never exceed 7.

    • getNumTiles

      public int getNumTiles​(int playerID)
      Gets the number of tiles the specified player has.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The ID of the player to check
      Returns:
      The number of tiles the player has

    • addTiles

      public void addTiles​(Tile[] tiles)
      Adds tiles to the rack of the local player. the number of tiles added must not overfill the rack
      Parameters:
      tiles - the tiles to add to the player's rack tiles.length should be equal to that of the most recent call to Board.playTiles() when playerID == LocalPlayer.ID

    • removeTiles

      public void removeTiles​(Tile[] tiles)
      Removes tiles from the LocalPlayer (necessary in the case of a failed challenge)
      Parameters:
      tiles - the tiles to remove. length less than or equal to 7

    • getPlayerTiles

      public ArrayList<Tile> getPlayerTiles()
      Gets the tiles of the local player
      Returns:
      the tiles of the local player

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
